As of June 19, according to Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List, #MukeshAmbani , Chairman of #Reliance Industries Limited, tops the list of Asia's wealthiest individuals with a net worth of $91.4 billion. Focused on diverse sectors including petrochemicals, textiles, and telecommunications, Ambani ranks 11th globally. The world's richest are #ElonMusk at $236.9 billion, Bernard Arnault with $231.9 billion, and Larry Ellison sitting at $156.2 billion.  Trailing behind Ambani is 68-year-old Zhong Shanshan, with a net worth of $64.2 billion. He founded Nongfu Spring, a beverage company, and Beijing Wantai Biological Pharmacy Enterprise, a key supplier of #Covid-19 testing kits. In the third position is #GautamAdani , chairperson of the Adani Group, with a net worth of $60 billion. His conglomerate is involved in a multitude of sectors including raw material exports and imports, mining, and energy.  The list reflects a strong presence from the Asian #BRICS nations; #China accounts for three entries in the list (or five if Hong Kong is included), and #India commands two out of the top three spots. The list is also notable for the diversity of industries represented, encompassing sectors that have significant global impact today. This includes pharmaceutical companies creating vaccines, like Beijing Wantai Biological Pharmacy, and technology giants such as ByteDance and Tencent, who own #TikTok and #WeChat respectively.  Also noteworthy is the presence of lithium-ion battery production and the gaming industry. William Lei Ding, owner of #NetEase, one of the world's most extensive online and mobile gaming businesses, comes in ninth with a net worth of $31.2 billion. Completing the top ten list is Colin Zheng Huang, founder of Pinduoduo, China's largest agricultural e-commerce platform, with a net worth of $28.1 billion.  In summary, the ten #richestmen in Asia have a combined net worth of $459.9 billion, highlighting not just their individual wealth, but also the economic dynamism and diversity of sectors shaping #Asia and, by extension, the world today.

#JioFinancial #Reliance  Jio Financial has total 630 Cr equity shares.   Present Market cap 1.54L Cr.  Book Value 1.14L Cr  Book Value per share 180 Rupees Valuation 1.35x FY23 book value  1. Of this 88.44 Cr shares (14% Equity) has been delivered in last 10 trading sessions since listing.  2. VWAP of these 88.44 shares delivered in last 10 sessions is 222.42 rupees. I feel this must act like reasonable support. 3. Weak hands including uninformed retail and passive funds have exited. 4. All FIIs and mutual funds who cannot and do not want to hold this share due to institutional imperatives have quit to large extent. 5. LIC has taken 6.66% stake through de merger. LIC acquisition price is 126 rupees ( reliance share price on 19th July* 4.68%)  6. Promoters hold around 47% stake and bought 3 Cr shares more from open market in last week.  7. Discloses on business plans and growth plans is next key here.   Disc. Invested
